bibl.title: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, November 25, 1940

div1.p: Brewer will send Hench more photographs from the Lazear memorial event. He notes that he cannot find the autographed photographs of Moran and Kissinger.

div1.head: Letter from Melvin D. Brewer to Philip Showalter Hench, November 25, 1940

opener.dateline:
THE ALUMNI ASSOCIATION
OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY
WASHINGTON AND JEFFERSON COLLEGE
WASHINGTON, PENNSYLVANIA
November 25, 1940

div1.p:
I have neglected answering some of your earlier
letters about the photographs because I thought I could
get some good views for you from another photographer
who was on the scene that day. I do have some photo-
graphs of his and will be glad to send you some of them
as soon as we have finished using some of these proofs
in a publication which we are getting up as a souvenir
of the Lazear Building and the South Campus. They are
about five by seven inches in size and would make ex-
cellent pieces for scrapbooks. When I have them alto-
gether, I will forward them to you and you may choose
the ones you would like to have.

In view of these facts, I have withheld send-
ing your check through because I thought we could use
some part of that check for these recent pictures.
Mr. Arnold told me that the pictures he has already
forwarded to you came to $18.50. With your permission,
I will hold the check until you have picked out some
of these smaller pictures.

I am forwarding you, under separate cover, the
pictures which you sent to Dr. Hutchison for our Found-
ers' Day programs. He asked me to send you also the
autographed pictures of Moran and Kissinger which you
sent in your letter to him. Are you sure that these
pictures were forwarded to us? The only pictures that
we have ever gotten of Moran and Kissinger came from
the men themselves. I am sending you copies of those
pictures which were used in all of our Founders' Day
publicity.

When your pictures arrived here before Founders'
Day, I remarked to Miss Hough as she gave them to me,
that the pictures of Moran and Kissinger were not there
as you had indicated in your letter. Is it possible
Page 2.
that you have given the pictures to a photographer who
has done some work for you in connection with the
Lazear research?
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Melvin D. Brewer
Alumni Secretary Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
